titles.title: Oz no Mahou Tsukai (1986)
The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
Il regno di Oz
オズの魔法使い (1986)
The Wizard of Oz
Im Land des Zauberers von Oz
Le magicien d`Oz
El Mago de Oz
Волшебник из страны Оз
Czarnoksiężnik z Krainy Oz
الساحر أوز
O Feiticeiro de Oz
De tovenaar van Oz
Ihmemaa Oz
הקוסם מארץ עוץ
Óz a Nagy Varázsló
Čarovnik iz Oza
El Mago de Oz

anime.description: * Based on The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, The Marvelous Land of Oz, Ozma of Oz, and The Emerald City of Oz by http://anidb.net/cr10265 [Lyman Frank Baum]. Off to see the marvelous land of Oz! Dorothy and her canine pal Toto live a quiet life on a Kansas farm with Uncle Henry and Aunt Em. But one day, the little girl and her dog find themselves spirited away from the fields of Kansas, to the magical land of Oz! Dorothy and Toto meet many friends on the yellow-brick road to Emerald City, where she hopes to find a way home to Kansas-- but when she arrives, the city’s mysterious ruler, the Wizard of Oz, is not what she expects! Source: crunchyroll

externalentity.identifier: オズの魔法使い_(テレビアニメ)

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: talking animal
tag.description: Talking animals are a common theme in mythology and folk tales, as well as children`s literature. Fictional talking creatures often are anthropomorphic, possessing human-like qualities but appearing as a creature. An animal that only knows how to say its name (for example, 99.9% of all http://anidb.net/t2493 [Pokemon]), are not talking animals.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: mina
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word mina refers to a broad audience, which can be said to be "the entire family", from the grumpy grandpa to the newborn baby. In Japanese, the word means simply "everyone", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic. Mina works are deliberately targeted at a range of people as wide as possible, and are commonly associated with high-budget releases that require a very large audience to be financially viable. They usually bring mildly philosophical themes so that the adults can be interested, but do so without bringing objectionable content so that the children can be allowed to watch, and indeed also feature content specifically geared to spark their interest.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: United States
tag.description: The United States of America (commonly referred to as the United States, the U.S., the USA, or America) is a federal constitutional republic comprising fifty states and a federal district. The country is situated mostly in central North America, where its forty-eight contiguous states and Washington, D.C., the capital district, lie between the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. The state of Alaska is in the north-west of the continent, with Canada to the east and Russia to the west across the Bering Strait. The state of Hawaii is an archipelago in the mid-Pacific. The country also possesses several territories in the Caribbean and Pacific. Source: wiki

tag.name: Americas
tag.description: The Americas, also collectively called America, encompass the totality of the continents of North America and South America. Together they make up most of Earth`s western hemisphere and comprise the New World. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: fairy tale
tag.description: This anime is either based on or contains parts of fairy tales. Usually those parts are highly modified or twisted when compared with the original source.

tag.name: remake
tag.description: This anime is a remake of a previously released story, anime, or movie.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: The Wizard of Oz
tag.description: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is an American children`s novel written by author http://anidb.net/cr10265 [L. Frank Baum] and illustrated by W. W. Denslow, originally published by the George M. Hill Company in Chicago on May 17, 1900. It has since been reprinted on numerous occasions, most often under the title The Wizard of Oz, which is the title of the popular 1902 Broadway musical as well as the iconic 1939 musical film adaptation. The story chronicles the adventures of a young farm girl named Dorothy in the magical Land of Oz, after she and her pet dog Toto are swept away from their Kansas home by a cyclone. The novel is one of the best-known stories in American literature and has been widely translated. The Library of Congress has declared it "America`s greatest and best-loved homegrown fairytale". Its groundbreaking success and the success of the Broadway musical adapted from the novel led Baum to write thirteen additional Oz books that serve as official sequels to the first story. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: ドロシーとたつまき
Dorothy and the Twister
Der Wirbelsturm
Dorothée rencontre les Munchkins
episode.summary: Dorothy lives with her Aunt and Uncle on their farm, but one day she is swept away by a tornado to another world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄色い道
The Yellow Brick Road
Freundschaft mit der Vogelscheuche
Dorothée se fait un ami
episode.summary: Dorothy learns a little about the Land of Oz and is set on the path to meet the Wizard in the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望への旅立ち
Setting Off on a Wishful Journey
Der Zinnmann
La route de briques jaunes
episode.summary: Scarecrow joins Dorothy on her journey, in hopes of getting a brain. Along the way, they meet a tin woodcutter. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 苦難の道
A Difficult Road
Die Kalidahs
En route pour la cité d`émeraudes
episode.summary: Dorothy and her new companions continue along the Yellow Brick Road, but many obstacles await them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒い花
Black Flowers
Die bösen Blumen
La reine des souris des champs
episode.summary: The river carries Dorothy and her friends away from the Yellow Brick Road, where they run into more trouble in a poppy field. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エメラルドの都
The Emerald City
Die Stadt der Smaragde
Enfin la cité d`émeraudes
episode.summary: As the group closes in on their destination, and after a little help from the Witch of the North, they finally meet the Wizard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 西の国の魔女
The Witch of the West
Die Böse Hexe des Westens
La requête du magicien
episode.summary: The Wizard isn`t quite what Dorothy expected, and is requesting assistance from her and her friends before he grants their wishes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウインキーの戦い
The Struggle of the Winkies
Angriff der Krähen
La méchante sorcière de l`ouest
episode.summary: Dorothy and her friends encounter new obstacles and dangers as they approach the home of the Wicked Witch of the West. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔女の館
The Witch`s Palace
Gefangen!
Les pouvoirs magiques de Dorothée
episode.summary: Dorothy has been captured by the Wicked Witch of the West, who plans to use the Ruby Slippers to conquer Oz. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ねらわれた靴
Desire for the Shoes
Die Macht des Wassers
La fin de la sorcière
episode.summary: Dorothy and Lion have a confrontation with the Witch, and they begin searching for their missing friends. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モンビとチップ
Mombi and Tip
Das Geheimnis um den Zauberhut
Mombi, Tip et la coiffe d`or
episode.summary: Dorothy has defeated the Wicked Witch of the West, but there are new dangers and friends on the horizon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新しい王様
The New King
Das Spinnenungeheuer
De retour à la cité d`émeraudes
episode.summary: Tin Man gets asked to stay and rule the Winkies, and the group heads off to tell the Wizard of their success. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オズ大王の正体
The True Oz
Der Falsche Zauberer
Le secret du magicien
episode.summary: Dorothy and her friends return to the Emerald City, excited to receive their rewards. The Wizard refuses, and his true nature is revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とり残されて
Left Behind
Fast am Ziel
La bonne volonté du faux magicien
episode.summary: Lion, Tin Man and Scarecrow go to the Wizard to receive their gifts. Dorothy, however, remains stuck in Oz. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 南への旅
Away to the South
Das Tal aus Porzellan
Le voyage vers le Sud
episode.summary: Dorothy has been left behind in Oz, but heads off to the south to see Glinda the Good Witch, in hopes of getting home. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔女グリンダの城
The Witch Glinda`s Castle
Das Labyrinth der Gnome
Glinda la bonne sorcière
episode.summary: The journey to Glinda`s palace has been filled with obstacles, including a detour to the Glass Village. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グリンダ
Glinda
Wieder daheim
Le retour à la maison
episode.summary: Dorothy has arrived at Glinda`s Palace. The magic of the ruby slippers is revealed, and Dorothy goes home. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カンサス
Kansas
Sehnsucht
Dorothée revoit le magicien
episode.summary: Dorothy has returned home, to her Aunt and Uncle. They`re having a difficult time believing her tales of Oz. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再びオズへ
Once More to Oz
Der Kürbisjunge
De nouveau au pays d`Oz
episode.summary: Dorothy`s missing shoe turns up, which she uses to return to Oz. She runs into a familiar face and might have a way home. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チップはお父さん
Tip`s a Father
Das Holzpferdchen
La fuite de chez Mombi
episode.summary: Mombi is planning to turn Dorothy and Tip into statues, so they escape in the night trying to reach the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジンジャー将軍
General Jinjur
Die Mädchenarmee
L`attaque de la générale Jinjur
episode.summary: Dorothy and her new friends continue to flee from Mombi, but they meet a woman along the way who plans to attack the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かかし王逃げだす
King Scarecrow`s Escape
Nieder mit König Vogelscheuche
La fuite de la cité d`émeraudes
episode.summary: Dorothy and Tip run to warn Scarecrow about General Ginjur, meanwhile Mombi catches up and arrives at the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 木こりは王様
Woodman, The King
Gefährliche Sonnenblumen
Le bûcheron vient à la rescousse
episode.summary: Ginjur and Mombi make a deal to hunt down Dorothy and her friends, but they arrive in the West and Tin Man offers to help them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モンビの魔法
Mombi`s Magic
Das trügerische Feuer
Les terribles pouvoirs de Mombi
episode.summary: Mombi has trapped the gang in a field on sunflowers, but Gingur disrupts her spell and they press on toward the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 力を合わせて
All Together
Gampu, der Flug-Elch
Pris au piège au palais !
episode.summary: Dorothy has been captured by Mombi and Gingur, but she and her friends have a secret weapon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガンプ
The Gump
Der Drachenritt
La fuite magique
episode.summary: The gang`s escape plan has stalled, but the Wizard`s tricks help buy them some time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 助けを求めて
Seeking Help
Ozma, das Findelkind
Glinda accorde son aide
episode.summary: Dorothy and her friends have been split up after their encounter with the dragon. After reuniting, they arrive at Glinda`s castle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再びエメラルド
The Emerald City Again
Eine feurige Rede
La cité d`émeraudes envahie
episode.summary: Gingur and Mombi hatch a plan to attack Glinda, but Glinda arrives at the Emerald City before they can march. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔法使いモンビ?
The Wizard Mombi?
Die Rosenbrosche
Mombi essaie de rouler Glinda
episode.summary: With Scarecrow back in his position as King, Mombi and Gingur try to leave, but are stopped by the citizens of the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チップの秘密
Tip`s Secret
Das Geheimnis um Ozma
Ozma la princesse d`Oz
episode.summary: Mombi refuses to talk about Ozma, but Glinda returns to help find the truth, and question Mombi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドロシーとチックタック
Dorothy and Tik-Tok
Tik Tak, der räuberische Roboter
Tic Tac l`homme mécanique
episode.summary: Dorothy has returned home to Kansas, but her adventures in Oz are far from over. A spell calls her back, where she meets a clockwork man. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラングディアの城
Langwidere`s Castle
Langudia, die launische Prinzessin
Le prince kidnappé
episode.summary: Dorothy and Tik Tok are off to see Princess Lulu, a mysterious ruler who is obsessed with hats. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 砂漠の旅
Journey in the Desert
In der Wüste
Le désert
episode.summary: Dorothy and her friends have been reunited, and they are off to find the Nome King. A desert stands between them and Nome Land, with many obstacles. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 砂漠のめんどり
Hen of the Desert
Die Geisterstadt
La poule bavarde
episode.summary: The gang has taken refuge in a wrecked ship, and finds a talking hen that has made it her home. Luckily, she knows the way to Nome Land. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オズのさい果て
The Edge of Oz
Die Menschen-Felsen
Les monstres de pierre
episode.summary: Travelling across a rocky land, the gang encounters more obstacles, including windy caves and giants made of stone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地底のノーム
Nomes of the Underground
Der Fluch
Le royaume souterrain des Nomes
episode.summary: Dorothy and the gang have finally found Nome Land, deep underground. The Nome King sets up a contest for them to win the Prince back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王様の難題
The King`s Challenge
Im Zauberraum des Gnomenkönigs
L`horrible jeu de devinette
episode.summary: The Nome King details the rules of his contest, and Lion and Tin Man decide to test their luck. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王様の好きなもの
The King`s Favorite
Des Prinzen Erlösung
Dorothée gagne au jeu de roi
episode.summary: Scarecrow takes his turn to find the Prince, but Lord Calico is full of tricks and lays a trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐ろしい部屋
A Scary Room
Gegen den Lavastrom
Le secret de la peur des Nomes
episode.summary: Dorothy has succeeded and freed her friends and the Prince, but escaping from the underground palace may be more difficult than it seems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明りを求めて
In Search of Light
Der rettende Fluß
Le roi des Nomes tend un piège
episode.summary: The Nome King sets his army to trapping Dorothy and her friends, and the gang has to navigate a series of devious traps. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再び地上へ
Above Ground Again
Ein böser Plan
Sauvés par le soleil
episode.summary: Moving closer to the surface, it seems like there`s hope that the gang will escape, but the Nome King isn`t done with them yet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ノームの反撃
The Nome Counterattack
Der Steinfresser
Le roi des Nomes prépare sa revanche
episode.summary: The Nome King has become obsessed with Dorothy and Oz, meanwhile Princess Ozma has gone missing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エメラルドの秘密
The Secret of the Emerald City
Das Smaragdzimmer
Le secret de la princesse d`Ozma
episode.summary: Dorothy is trying to teach Ozma how to be Queen, but Oz has bigger problems on the horizon. The Nomes are on the march. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チョッキンペットの国
The Land of the Cuttenclips
Eine Welt ganz aus Papier
Les soldats de papier
episode.summary: Ozma has discovered her past, and her magic, which she uses to transport herself and Dorothy to Paper Land. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オズの国の刈り入れ
Harvest in the Land of Oz
Froschkopf, der Eierfresser
Le monstre grognon se joint aux Nomes
episode.summary: Ozma continues to practice her magic with Dorothy, and the Nome King`s army digs closer to the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忘れの泉
The Fountain of Oblivion
Die Quelle des Vergessens
Le puits de l`éternel oubli
episode.summary: The Growleywog is at the front of the Nome invasion, and Guff plots against his own people. Ozma rehearses for her coronation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バケクビ暴れる
The Rampage of the Growleywog
Der Steinfresser beißt auf Eisen
Les Nomes sont en marche
episode.summary: The Nomes have reached the Land of the Winkies, and the Growleywog gets a chance to eat. Dorothy leaves Oz to go check on Tin Man. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガフ善人ななる
A Kinder Guph
Der Angriff der Gnome
Le roi reçoit de l`aide
episode.summary: The Nome King has been delayed by an iron wall, but he`s still a threat to Oz. Dorothy arrives to help Tin Man with the Growleywog. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戴冠式
The Coronation
Die Krönung
Le couronnement d`Ozma
episode.summary: Guff has infiltrated the Emerald City and drank the Water of Oblivion. Ozma goes to confront the Growleywog. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ノーム王の勝利
The Nome King`s Victory
Geheimwaffe "Ei"
L`attaque des Nomes
episode.summary: Dorothy has a nightmare about her home in Kansas. While she`s sleeping, the Nomes and the Growleywog have invaded the Emerald City. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドロシーがんばる
Dorothy Does Her Best
Mit letzter Kraft
Dorothée et ses amis défendent le palais
episode.summary: Dorothy and Scarecrow hatch a plan to send the Nomes running, but the Growleywog is a tougher foe to be rid of. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なつかしのカンサス
Dear Old Kansas
Ende gut, alles gut
Tout est bien qui finit bien
episode.summary: The Nome king may have defeated Dorothy and the Scarecrow! Who will be able to save the people of Emerald City? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: The Emerald City of Oz
episode.summary: Episodes 42 to 52 re-edited into a movie format

episode.title: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
episode.summary: Episodes 1-17 re-edited into a movie format
